Data standard for Covid-19 testing

Draft v02, Last updated August 18th, 2020

This data standard can help states and regions ensure consistency about Covid-19 tests across government agencies, vendors, and technology platforms.

Types of data

We've selected the fields for this data standard to minimize the administrative burden of completing a test, with additional areas selected to improve capacities for analysis, contact tracing, and testing operations.

Priority areas include:

  • Structured fields for personal information such as name, date of birth, address, and contact information,
  • Structured categories for symptoms, work settings, occupations, and places that may have been exposed,
  • Information about insurance providers to support the long-term costs of testing, and
  • Inclusive options for gender identity, sexual orientation, and housing status.

In all cases, we've prioritized the use of existing standards and taxonomies from federal agencies including the CDC, Census, and Department of Labor. Our model forms are built with the US Web Design System, which is maintained by the US Digital Service.

In a given state or region, you may choose to use this standard completely, or select sections to reuse or adapt based on your current needs.

How to read this standard

This standard provides technical documentation for developers and data analysts. For a preview of what this form looks like online, check out our model form.

For a higher-level overview of how this standard can fit into a state or region's testing operations, check out our overview section.

Reason for being tested

This fieldset contains options for why the person is looking to get a test, displayed as checkboxes so that they can select all that apply. View in model form

Legend Helper text
Reason for being tested Select all that apply
Label ID Input type Validation Error text
I have symptoms of Covid-19 symptomatic checkbox Must select at least one option Select a reason for being tested
I was asked to get tested as part of a random sample random-sample checkbox Must select at least one option Select a reason for being tested
I work in a profession that's been asked to get tested sentinel-group checkbox Must select at least one option Select a reason for being tested
I attended an event with more than 100 people large-event checkbox Must select at least one option Select a reason for being tested
I recently traveled or am about to travel travel checkbox Must select at least one option Select a reason for being tested
I have been in contact with someone who tested positive been-in-contact checkbox Must select at least one option Select a reason for being tested
Other reason-other checkbox If selected, show other-reason field Select a reason for being tested
Other reason other-reason text Hidden on default. Appears if "Other" is selected, and becomes a required field. Must contain text How would you describe why you're getting tested?

Name

This fieldset uses a standard template from the US Web Design System for first name, middle name, and last name. View in model form

Legend Helper text
Name [None]
Label ID Input type Validation Error text
First name first-name text Must contain at least one character Enter your first name
Middle name (optional) middle-name text n/a
Last name last-name text Must contain at least one character Enter your last name

Date of birth

This fieldset uses a standard template from the US Web Design System for requesting month, day, and year. View in model form

Legend Helper text
Date of birth [None]
Label ID Input type Validation Error text
Month dob-month text Must be a number between 1 and 12 Enter the month when you were born in a number format, such as 1 (January) or 12 (December)
Day dob-day text Must be a number between 1 and 31 Enter the day of the month when you were born
Year dob-year text Must be a number between 1900 and 2030 Enter the year when you were born

Phone number

This fieldset requests the person's phone number. The helper text informs them that we'll be using it to provide updates, which can help them choose which number to include. View in model form

Legend Helper text
Phone number We'll use this phone number to provide updates
Label ID Input type Validation Error text
[None] phone-number tel Must be valid phone number Enter your phone number with an area code, such as 555 555 5555

Email address

This fieldset requests the person's email address. The helper text informs them that we'll be using it to send a confirmation email, which can help them choose which email address to include. View in model form

Selecting the "no-email" checkbox will allow form submission for persons who do not have an email address.

Legend Helper text
Email address We'll send a confirmation message to this email address
Label ID Input type Validation Error text
[None] email-address email Must be valid email address Please enter your email address. If you don't have one, you can select the checkbox below.
I don't have an email address no-email checkbox If selected, email-address field is hidden and not required n/a

Address

This fieldset uses a standard template from the US Web Design System for requesting a U.S. mailing address. View in model form

The "no-address" checkbox allows form submission for persons who do not currently have an address.

Legend Helper text
Address Your household address. This information will help us understand the spread of COVID-19.

Street address 2 address-2 text n/a
City city text Must contain text Enter your city
State state select Must select an option Select a state
ZIP Code zip text Must be 5-digit ZIP Code Enter a five-digit ZIP Code
I do not currently have an address no-address checkbox If selected, hides address fields and makes them no longer required n/a

This fieldset asks how many persons live in the person's household, and if their residence is one of two types of congregate living. View in model form

Insurance information

This fieldset requests information about the person's health insurance policy to support the costs of testing. View in model form

The "no-health-insurance" checkbox allows form submission if the person does not have health insurance. Selecting the "additional-health-insurance" checkbox can open up the fieldset for additional insurance information.

Legend Helper text
Insurance information Covid-19 testing is currently covered by all insurance companies. If you have insurance, you please enter the information here. If you do not currently have insurance, testing is free at locations managed by [Your State or Region].
Label ID Input type Validation Error text
Health insurance provider name provider-name text Must contain text If you have an insurance provider, include their name here. If you don't currently have access to insurance, you can select "I do not have health insurance" below.
ID Number insurance-id-number text Must contain text Include your ID Number here
Insurance policyholder's name policy-holder-name text Must contain text Include the policyholder's name here
Relationship to policyholder policyholder-relationship select Must select an option. These include:
  • Self
  • Parent
  • Child
  • Spouse
  • Domestic partner
  • Custodial adult
  • Other
 Select the option that best describes your relationship to the policyholder
I do not have health insurance no-health-insurance checkbox If selected, insurance fields are hidden and not required n/a
I have an additional health insurance provider additional-health-insurance checkbox If selected, show fields for additional insurance provider n/a

Additional insurance information

This fieldset requests information about an additional health insurance policy that the person can include to support the costs of testing. It's hidden on default on the model form, and appears after the the "additional-health-insurance" checkbox is selected. View in model form

Legend Helper text
Additional insurance information Enter the information for your additional health insurance provider below
Label ID Input type Validation Error text

ID Number insurance-id-number-2 text Must contain text Include your ID Number here
Insurance policyholder's name policy-holder-name-2 text Must contain text Include the policyholder's name here
Relationship to policyholder policyholder-relationship-2 select Must select an option. These include:
  • Self
  • Parent
  • Child
  • Spouse
  • Domestic partner
  • Custodial adult
  • Other
 Select the option that best describes your relationship to the policyholder

Primary care provider

This fieldset requests the name of the person's primary care provider (PCP) using an autocomplete textfield. View in model form

In the model form, we've used Accessible autocomplete from the UK Government Digital Service, which is optimized for accessibility, usability, and compatibility across browsers and devices. Its options pull from a public list of all registered physicians in Rhode Island that's been formatted as a JSON file. View example file

The "no-pcp" checkbox allows form submission if the person does not have a primary care provider, and the "pcp-not-found" checkbox allows form submission if the person cannot identify their PCP in the autocomplete list.

Legend Helper text
Primary Care Provider If you have a primary care doctor, search for their name below
Label ID Input type Validation Error text
[None] PCP-name Autocomplete text box Must select an option from database of primary care providers Search for your Primary Care Provider by entering their name above. If you don't have a Primary Care Provider, you can select "I do not have a Primary Care Provider" below.
I am not able to find my Primary Care Provider in this list pcp-not-found checkbox If selected, hides PCP fields n/a
I do not have a Primary Care Provider no-pcp checkbox If selected, hides PCP fields n/a

Symptoms in the past 24 hours

This fieldset requests identification of any symptoms that the person experienced in the past 24 hours. Its checkboxes are optional, and the helper text asks to select all that apply. View in model form

If any of the symptoms are selected, an additional question, "current-symptoms-onset-date," will appear to request the day when the person began experiencing symptoms.

Selecting "I have not experienced symptoms" allows form submission without selecting any symptoms.

Recent locations

This fieldset requests identification of types of locations where the person has spent 15 minutes or more in the past two weeks. View in model form

Its sections are organized under headings to make the lists easy to scan, and helper text invites persons to select all that apply.

Primary occupation

This collection of fieldsets ask for the person's occupation, with options that map to the Department of Labor's Standard Occupational Classification (SOC) as organized by the Occupational Information Network. View on model form

As the SOC contains 867 occupations to choose from, this list reduces the user burden by consolidating to a list of around 150 occupation-types organized in groups based on what the person selects as their workplace setting.

View CSV that maps these fields to SOC codes
View CSV that maps these fields to NAICS codes

Workplace address

This fieldset requests the person's workplace address using the standard template from the US Web Design System. It is hidden on default, and only appears if the person has selected "sometimes-wfh" or "no-wfh".View in model form

Selecting the "workplace-address-incomplete" checkbox should set all of these fields to be optional, allowing form submission with partial information.

The "secondary-workplace-travel" checkbox allows the person to indicate that their work involves traveling between different locations.

When the "workplace-address-additional" checkbox is selected, the secondary-workplace-address" fields are shown.

Legend Helper text
Where is your current workplace located? The address where you work most of the time. This information will help us understand the spread of COVID-19.
Label ID Input type Validation Error text
Street address 1 workplace-address-1 text Must contain text Enter your address
Street address 2 (optional) workplace-address-2 text Optional n/a
City workplace-city text Must contain text Enter your city
State workplace-state select Must select an option Select a state
ZIP Code workplace-zip text Must be 5-digit ZIP Code Enter a five-digit ZIP Code
Most of my work involves traveling between different locations workplace-travel checkbox Optional n/a
I am not able to provide a complete address for this workplace workplace-address-incomplete checkbox If selected, makes workplace-address fields no longer required Please enter as much information as you can

The "workplace-travel" checkbox allows the person to indicate that their work involves traveling between different locations.
